phrase: To give up a throne voluntarily
usage: The king decided to abdicate in favor of his son.

phrase: A person who is concerned with the welfare of others
usage: She was known as an altruist, always putting others before herself.

phrase: A person who loves or collects books
usage: Being a bibliophile, he spent most of his weekends at the local library.

phrase: An expert judge in matters of taste
usage: She was a connoisseur of fine wines and always selected the best vintages.

phrase: A political leader who seeks support by appealing to popular desires and prejudices
usage: The politician was accused of being a demagogue, manipulating emotions instead of using facts.

phrase: Lasting for a very short time
usage: Her fame was ephemeral, lasting only a few months.

phrase: An action obstructing progress in a legislative assembly without breaking procedures
usage: He launched a filibuster to delay the passing of the bill.

phrase: An excessively greedy eater
usage: Despite being a glutton, he managed to stay fit through regular exercise.

phrase: A person who believes the pursuit of pleasure is the most important thing
usage: As a hedonist, he spent much of his time seeking new experiences and pleasures.

phrase: A person predominantly concerned with their own thoughts and feelings
usage: Being an introvert, she preferred spending quiet evenings at home.

phrase: Extreme patriotism, especially in aggressive foreign policy
usage: The speech was filled with jingoism, calling for aggressive action against other countries.

phrase: A person with a compulsive desire to steal
usage: He was diagnosed as a kleptomaniac, unable to resist the urge to steal small items.

phrase: A person opposed to increased industrialization or technology
usage: As a Luddite, she refused to buy a smartphone and used an old flip phone instead.

phrase: A person who dislikes, despises, or is prejudiced against women
usage: His misogynist views were apparent in his dismissive comments about women.

phrase: A person who has an excessive interest in or admiration of themselves
usage: He was such a narcissist, constantly admiring his reflection in every mirror.

phrase: An animal or person that eats both plants and animals
usage: Humans are generally omnivores, able to eat both plants and meat.

phrase: A person who seeks to promote the welfare of others
usage: The philanthropist donated millions to help improve education in impoverished areas.

phrase: Representing the most typical example of a quality or class
usage: Her elegant style was quintessential of the high society.

phrase: A person who tells anecdotes in a skillful and amusing way
usage: As a raconteur, he kept the audience engaged with his storytelling.

phrase: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important to gain advantage
usage: He was known as a sycophant, always trying to flatter his boss for promotion.

phrase: A person who never drinks alcohol
usage: As a teetotaler, she always opted for water at social gatherings.

phrase: One who believes in maximizing utility for the greatest number of people
usage: The utilitarian approach focuses on achieving the greatest good for the majority.

phrase: Wanting or devouring great quantities of food; eager in activities
usage: He was a voracious reader, finishing a book every week.

phrase: A strong desire to travel
usage: Her wanderlust led her to visit over thirty countries in her lifetime.

phrase: An individual attracted to foreign cultures or customs
usage: A xenophile, he loved exploring different cultures and making friends abroad.

phrase: An uneducated and unsophisticated person from the countryside
usage: Despite being a yokel, he quickly adapted to city life.

phrase: A person who is fanatical and uncompromising in pursuit of ideals
usage: He was a zealot for environmental conservation, willing to go to any lengths to protect nature.

phrase: One who is not sure about God's existence
usage: He identified as an agnostic, questioning but not denying a higher power.

phrase: A person who deliberately sets fire to a building
usage: The fire was determined to be the act of an arsonist.

phrase: One who does a thing for pleasure and not as a profession
usage: Though he was an amateur, his talent was undeniable.

phrase: One who can use either hand with ease
usage: Her ambidextrous skills impressed everyone in the class.

phrase: One who makes an official examination of accounts
usage: The auditor found discrepancies in the accounts.

phrase: A person who believes in or tries to bring about a state of lawlessness
usage: As an anarchist, he opposed all forms of structured government.

phrase: A person who has changed his faith
usage: He was labeled an apostate after leaving his former faith.

phrase: One who does not believe in the existence of God
usage: Her firm beliefs aligned with those of an atheist.

phrase: A person appointed by two parties to solve a dispute
usage: The arbitrator was called to resolve the conflict.

phrase: One who leads a life of self-denial and contemplation
usage: He adopted an ascetic lifestyle, abstaining from all material pleasures.

phrase: A series of stars
usage: The constellation Orion is visible in winter.

phrase: A funeral procession
usage: The cortege made its way slowly through town.

phrase: A group of worshippers
usage: The congregation gathered at the church every Sunday.

phrase: A herd or flock of animals being driven in a body
usage: The drove of sheep moved across the field.

phrase: A system of government by the whole population or all eligible members
usage: In a democracy, citizens have the right to vote.

phrase: A person having a sophisticated charm
usage: He entered the room with a debonair smile, charming everyone instantly.

phrase: A dabbler in art, science, and literature (not serious)
usage: She was a dilettante in many fields but never pursued one deeply.

phrase: One who enjoys the pleasures of eating and drinking
usage: He was an epicure, always seeking the finest dining experiences.

phrase: One who often talks of his achievements
usage: The egotist could not stop bragging about his accomplishments.

phrase: Someone who leaves one country to settle in another
usage: The emigrant family started a new life in another country.

phrase: A man who is womanish in his habits
usage: He was often described as effeminate due to his graceful mannerisms.

phrase: One who is hard to please and very selective in habits
usage: She was fastidious about her choices, accepting only the best.

phrase: One who runs away from justice
usage: The fugitive was on the run for years before being captured.

phrase: One filled with excessive enthusiasm in religious matters
usage: The fanatic could not accept any views but his own.

phrase: One who believes in fate
usage: As a fatalist, she believed everything was preordained.

phrase: A small fleet of ships or boats
usage: A flotilla of boats lined up for the regatta.

phrase: A small growth of trees without underbrush
usage: The grove offered a cool, shaded place to relax.

phrase: A state, society, or group governed by old people
usage: The gerontocracy was out of touch with the youth.

phrase: A lover of good food
usage: As a gourmand, he was always searching for delicious cuisine.

phrase: Conferred as an honor
usage: She received an honorary degree from the university.

phrase: A person who acts against religion
usage: The heretic was shunned for his unconventional beliefs.

phrase: A person of intellectual or erudite tastes
usage: He was a highbrow, enjoying art galleries and classical music.

phrase: A patient with imaginary symptoms and ailments
usage: The hypochondriac constantly worried about new ailments.

usage: A flotilla of boats lined up for the regatta.

usage: The grove offered a cool, shaded place to relax.

phrase: A state, society, or group governed by old people
usage: The gerontocracy was out of touch with the youth.

phrase: A lover of good food
usage: As a gourmand, he was always searching for delicious cuisine.

phrase: Conferred as an honor
usage: She received an honorary degree from the university.

phrase: A person who acts against religion
usage: The heretic was shunned for his unconventional beliefs.

phrase: A person of intellectual or erudite tastes
usage: He was a highbrow, enjoying art galleries and classical music.

phrase: A patient with imaginary symptoms and ailments
usage: The hypochondriac constantly worried about new ailments.

phrase: A person who is controlled by his wife
usage: He was often teased for being henpecked.

phrase: A community of people smaller than a village
usage: They lived in a small hamlet far from any major city.

phrase: A large group of people
usage: A horde of fans gathered outside the stadium.

phrase: One with sustained enthusiastic action and unflagging vitality
usage: Her indefatigable spirit kept the team motivated.

phrase: Someone who attacks cherished ideas or traditional institutions
usage: The iconoclast challenged all the established beliefs.

phrase: One who behaves without moral principles
usage: His immoral actions shocked the community.

phrase: A person who is incapable of being tampered with
usage: The fortress was considered impregnable.

phrase: One unable to pay his debts
usage: He declared himself insolvent after the business failed.

phrase: A state run by the worst, least qualified, or most unscrupulous citizens
usage: The people felt trapped in a kakistocracy.

phrase: A person who is mentally ill
usage: In earlier times, a lunatic was often shunned by society.

phrase: A form of government with a monarch at the head
usage: The country had been a monarchy for centuries.

phrase: A person who dislikes humankind and avoids human society
usage: The misanthrope preferred the company of books to people.

phrase: A person primarily concerned with making money at the expense of ethics
usage: He was seen as a mercenary, caring only for profit.

phrase: Someone who is all-powerful
usage: The deity was considered omnipotent in their beliefs.

phrase: A person whose job is to examine people's eyes
usage: The optometrist recommended new lenses for better vision.

phrase: One who sees only the negative side of things
usage: The pessimist could find a downside to any good news.

phrase: A person who has more than one spouse at the same time
usage: Polygamy was practiced in certain societies.

phrase: Having complete or unlimited knowledge
usage: The omniscient narrator knew everything about each character's thoughts and feelings.
